abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome rating of the
            National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project -
            Pronasar for Peru was judged to be moderately
            unsatisfactory.  The Bank and borrower performance were
            moderately unsatisfactory. The risk to development outcome
            was high. Significant changes included restructuring of
            project methodology and implementation. Several lessons were
            learned. Accelerating water and sanitation services requires
            a common strategy and the simplification of the
            country's complex administrative processes. A more
            decentralized approach to planning, execution and monitoring
            of projects needs to be emphasized to go to scale and ensure
            sustainability, supported by a strong center and continuous
            capacity building and institutional strengthening. Municipal
            co-financing and community contribution requirements need to
            be better adapted to the local context. Community
            participation in planning and operations underpins
            sustainability, but adequate financial incentives are
            necessary for continued participation. It is important to
            think more holistically and involve other sectors in order
            to achieve the higher level impact of improved health benefits.
